item.title: Remote Videographer for Online Course Creation - Upwork
item.description:
Remote Videographer for Online Course Creation

I'm looking for a skilled videographer to join me in creating engaging video content for an upcoming online course.

This project spans six lessons, with five lessons each lasting 1.5 hours and one shorter lesson under 30 minutes. I have already developed the syllabus, workbook, slide decks, and assignments.

Responsibilities:
- Collaborate closely with me to plan and execute remote video shoots for the course.
- Provide expertise in setting up equipment and advising on effective filming techniques.
- Edit and refine video content to ensure it aligns seamlessly with the course materials and enhances the learning experience.
- Maintain clear communication and meet deadlines throughout the project duration.

Requirements:
- Proven experience in videography, particularly in educational or instructional content creation.
- Proficiency in video editing software to produce polished and professional final products.
- Familiarity with online course platforms (experience with Thinkific is a plus).
- A strong portfolio demonstrating previous work in video production for educational purposes.

If you are passionate about educational content creation and have the skills to bring my course materials to life through video, I'd love to hear from you. Please include your portfolio showcasing relevant work along with your application.


Budget: $1,500

item.title: Video editor for Christian Children's TV show - Upwork
item.description:
I am producing a weekly Christian Children's TV show. I have the available raw footage. I will need a video editor to compete and prepare it for TV. This will also require occasional green screen footage and outside video clips. I will also need minimal animation work done and several motion graphics, as well.  These are 28-minute episodes and we will need 13 Episodes completed ASAP.  Also, I have a completed sample of an episode for review if you are interested. All episodes follow the exact format; transitions, intro, exit,  etc.  I am in a time crunch, so if you cannot work consistently until we finish the project, please do not reply.
